intro: Gymnosiphon celebicus, commonly known as the Celebes gymnosiphon, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Sulawesi in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, showy flowers that resemble small, colorful lanterns. The plant produces woody capsules that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Gymnosiphon celebicus is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species and is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
